result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:05 PM Defendant Brandon J Pancoast in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he was just released from custody today and has not yet had the opportunity to fill out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court sets for status of counsel in one week and defendant to either bring the Petition to Court or return it to the Clerk's office prior to the next date.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendancy of this action.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.    Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:26 PM Defendant Brandon J Pancoast in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant is given 2 petition for appointment of counsel forms.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
